Reasoning: Subnet IP exhaustion prevents new resource launches (pods, EC2, Lambda ENIs). 20 IP threshold provides buffer for typical autoscaling operations. EKS node + pods require 10-20 IPs depending on instance type and CNI config. Minimum statistic ensures alarm triggers before complete exhaustion. Requires Lambda-based custom metric (no native CloudWatch metric).

90% utilization provides limited buffer before exhaustion during rapid scaling events. Maximum statistic captures worst-case utilization. 2/2 datapoints ensures sustained high utilization vs. momentary spike. Action: add secondary CIDR, create additional subnets, or review IP allocation efficiency.

Capacity planning threshold at 75% provides advance notice for subnet expansion planning. 3/4 datapoints reduces sensitivity - intended for proactive capacity management, not immediate response. Enables architectural reviews and change request preparation before reaching critical thresholds.
